    See StringUtils.replace(String, String, String)

    See StringUtils.replace(String, String, String, int)
    static CharSequence
    replaceAt(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, int length, CharSequence replaceWith)
    Replaces the substring starting at startAt having a length of length with the string replaceWith.

    startAt:
    If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
    If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

    length:
    If length is positive, it represents the length of the portion of searchIn which is to be replaced.
    If length is negative, it represents the number of characters from the end of searchIn at which to stop replacing.
    If length is 0 the text will be inserted at the given position.

    Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
    static CharSequence
    replaceAt(CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, CharSequence replaceWith)
    Replaces the substring starting at startAt with the string replaceWith.

    startAt:
    If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
    If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

    Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
    static @Nullable CharSequence
    replaceAtNullable(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, int length, @Nullable CharSequence replaceWith)
    Replaces the substring starting at startAt having a length of length with the string replaceWith.

    startAt:
    If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
    If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

    length:
    If length is positive, it represents the length of the portion of searchIn which is to be replaced.
    If length is negative, it represents the number of characters from the end of searchIn at which to stop replacing.
    If length is 0 the text will be inserted at the given position.

    Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
    static @Nullable CharSequence
    replaceAtNullable(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, @Nullable CharSequence replaceWith)
    Replaces the substring starting at startAt with the string replaceWith.

    startAt:
    If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
    If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

    Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php

    • countMatches

      public static int countMatches(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, @Nullable CharSequence searchFor, int startAt)

      Counts how many times the substring appears in the larger String starting at the given position.

      Parameters:
      searchIn - the String to check, may be null
      searchFor - the substring to count, may be null
      Returns:
      the number of occurrences, 0 if either String is null

    • replaceAt

      public static CharSequence replaceAt(CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, CharSequence replaceWith)
      Replaces the substring starting at startAt with the string replaceWith.

      startAt:
      If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
      If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

      Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
      Parameters:
      startAt - position where to insert the text (0=before 1st character, 1=after 1st character, 2=after 2nd character)

    • replaceAt

      public static CharSequence replaceAt(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, int length, CharSequence replaceWith)
      Replaces the substring starting at startAt having a length of length with the string replaceWith.

      startAt:
      If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
      If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

      length:
      If length is positive, it represents the length of the portion of searchIn which is to be replaced.
      If length is negative, it represents the number of characters from the end of searchIn at which to stop replacing.
      If length is 0 the text will be inserted at the given position.

      Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
      Parameters:
      startAt - position where to insert the text (0=before 1st character, 1=after 1st character, 2=after 2nd character)
      length - number of characters to replace

    • replaceAtNullable

      public static @Nullable CharSequence replaceAtNullable(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, @Nullable CharSequence replaceWith)
      Replaces the substring starting at startAt with the string replaceWith.

      startAt:
      If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
      If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

      Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
      Parameters:
      startAt - position where to insert the text (0=before 1st character, 1=after 1st character, 2=after 2nd character)

    • replaceAtNullable

      public static @Nullable CharSequence replaceAtNullable(@Nullable CharSequence searchIn, int startAt, int length, @Nullable CharSequence replaceWith)
      Replaces the substring starting at startAt having a length of length with the string replaceWith.

      startAt:
      If startAt is positive, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th offset into searchIn.
      If startAt is negative, the replacing will begin at the startAt'th character from the end of searchIn.

      length:
      If length is positive, it represents the length of the portion of searchIn which is to be replaced.
      If length is negative, it represents the number of characters from the end of searchIn at which to stop replacing.
      If length is 0 the text will be inserted at the given position.

      Behavior is based on PHP's substr_replace function http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.substr-replace.php
      Parameters:
      startAt - position where to insert the text (0=before 1st character, 1=after 1st character, 2=after 2nd character)
      length - number of characters to replace

    • replaceIgnoreCase

      public static CharSequence replaceIgnoreCase(String searchIn, @Nullable String searchFor, @Nullable CharSequence replaceWith)
      Replace all occurrences of the search string with the replacement string. This method is case insensitive.
      Parameters:
      searchIn - The string to search
      searchFor - The string to find
      replaceWith - The string to replace searchFor with.
      Returns:
      Returns searchIn with all occurrences of searchFor replaced with replaceWith. If any parameter is null, searchIn will be returned.

    • substringAfter

      public static String substringAfter(String searchIn, char searchFor)
      Searches a string from left to right and returns the rightmost characters of the string. substringBefore("this is a test", "s") -> "thi"
      Parameters:
      searchIn - The string whose leftmost characters you want to find.
      searchFor - A substring of searchIn. right.
      Returns:
      The rightmost characters in searchIn. The number of characters returned is determined by searchFor. Returns an empty string if searchFor is not part of searchIn.

      Parameters:

    • substringBeforeIgnoreCaseNullable

      public static @Nullable String substringBeforeIgnoreCaseNullable(@Nullable String searchIn, @Nullable String searchFor)
      Searches a string from left to right and returns the leftmost characters of the string. substringBeforeIgnoreCare("this is a test", "s") -> "thi"
      Parameters:
      searchIn - The string whose leftmost characters you want to find.
      searchFor - A substring of searchIn. Left returns the characters to the left of searchFor. It finds searchFor by searching searchIn from left to right.
      Returns:
      The leftmost characters in searchIn. The number of characters returned is determined by searchFor. Returns "" if searchFor is not part of searchIn. Returns "" if searchIn is null.

      Returns:
